channel.title: How to identify currently-executing queries
channel.description:
We have a self-hosted, Dockerized Redash instance. How can I go about identifying currently-executing queries?
I found some discussion here http://discuss.redash.io/t/users-running-queries-or-query-history/5122/2 about querying the DB or checking the audit logs. Is this still the recommended solution? If so, where do the audit logs live in the Dockerized environment?
Cheers and thanks!

item.title: How to identify currently-executing queries
item.dc:creator: its_suz_p
item.description:
We have a self-hosted, Dockerized Redash instance. How can I go about identifying currently-executing queries?

Cheers and thanks!
